content:
(CHUCKLING) Oh, yeah,
sitting on your big fat butt.

All right, that is
the number to beat.
What do we get if we do them?

Okay, I'll make it
a little more interesting.

Anyone who does
more than 25 pushups...

Here we go.
No, no, no, butt too high.

What do we got?
Creed, disqualified.

I had a really hard
workout this morning.

ALL: Stanley! Stanley!
Stanley! Stanley! Stanley!

Essentially what we have
here is one of those stories

where a mother lifts
a car to save her baby.

He's got all this weight
that's helping him go down.

One more! One more, Stanley!
Yeah, come on! You can do it.

Come on, Stanley!
Let's do it. Come on.

OSCAR: Are you okay?
MICHAEL: Very nicely done.

(SCOFFS) No.
I always come in at 7:00.

Hey, are you doing
anything later tonight?

If you hear of anything
going on, let me know.

Couple hours to kill
before work.

You know what we haven't
done in a while?

Upstairs, the warehouse,
everybody just going out for a drink.

Didn't we?
I think we did.

Yeah, the whole gang.
Matt included.

Look, just be straight
with me, man.

You can be gay with Matt,
just be straight with me.

So, what do you think?
PHYLLIS: Hmm.

I saw a new drink
on TV I'd like to try.

Yeah. I love going
to bars with Bob.

I tend to wear
something low-cut,

get men to flirt with me,
and Bob beats them up.

A bunch of us are talking
about happy hour.
I would love, love, love to go.

Pam's at home with the baby
and I think she wants a night in.

Absolutely.
I'll do that right now.

I gotta tell you,
this baby is amazing.
She gets me out of everything.

And I love her.
I also love her very much.

were thinking of going
out tonight, but I told them...

PAM: Yes! Yes,
I would love to!

It's been So long since
I've been with adults.
I'm so excited to see everybody.

Creed, Ryan.
Oh, my God, Stanley!
Stanley's gonna be there. Yes! Oh, my God...
I did not see this coming.

Erin, I need you to fax this and
get me a confirmation, pronto.

Talk to me that way again
and I'll cut your face off.

We recently struck up a
romantic relationship, and...

But we're kind of
keeping it quiet for now,

'cause it's still kind of a
new thing, it's a little delicate,

and we just don't want
all the drama. Exactly.

Yeah, 'cause when everyone
knows, it... (KNOCK ON WINDOW)

That's actually pretty funny,
but in general, you know...

A bunch of us are going
to get some drinks. You in?

Ladies and gentlemen,
it is quitting time.
Trying to get a head count.

Hey, I invited my
friend Julie. Okay.
I want her to meet Michael.

They're both single. I
have a sense they might...

You've been
gone for a long time.

Oh, I missed you so much.
Oh!

Well, when a new mom
hears a baby cry,

her you-know-what's
fill up with you know what,

and then her shirt gets,
you know...

Oh, wow. I cannot believe this is
happening. This is everything I dreamed.

It's not a birthday,
it's not a goodbye party.

Hey, Pam and I
are gonna go play pool

with one of her friends,
and we need a fourth.
Would you like to be our fourth?

So, the guy shows
me the deck he's built,

and I'm like, "I'll call this a
deck if it'll make you happy,

"but this is just
a porch without a roof."

It was, like, you could maybe
get two chairs on the thing.

MICHAEL: Hello. How are you?
Hi.

What is a nice girl like you
hanging out with these bums for?
So you work with Pam and Jim?

Oh, no, no. Pam
and Jim work for me,
and if they win, they are fired.

(CHUCKLES) No. No. Not really.
Not really. But they better not win.

Hey.
PAM: Hey, Isabel, you made it.

I'm gonna do a lap, see
if I know anyone. Okay.

And then they said the most
ridiculous thing about Anderson Cooper,

which I do not have
the decency to repeat,

but trust me when
I tell you that it...

What's a girl like you
doing in a place like this?

A girl like me is why a guy like
you comes to a place like this.

Usually means there's
a battle scene coming.

See, I didn't think
you could teach that.

I thought that was
something you were born with.
What am I thinking right now?

Are you thinking
that I said ESP?

Yes. I feel like
an idiot. Awesome.

I was a little nervous when
Pam told me he was her boss,

but he doesn't act
like a boss at all.

If I had a boss like that,
we'd never get anything done.

So you like her?
Uh, yeah, sure.
About you two hitting it off.

Well, apparently
Michael Scott is on a date,

and that... That, my
friend, changes everything.

My brother, good head, bad
heart. Good head, bad heart.

PAM: Yeah, you told me
about him. JULIE: Yeah.

PAM: Oh, boy!
JULIE: He's all right.

Hey, Michael,
where have you been?

Hey, you're supposed to
hit the white ball first, buddy.

Can I talk to you for a
second? Mmm-hmm.

Everything okay? Why
are you wearing a hat now?

Guys, come on.
I'm on a date.

Hi, I'm Date Mike.
Nice to meet me.

How do you like
your eggs in the morning?

Do you want to
just make a run for it?

Guys, we're focusing.
We can't talk.

All right, it's all yours.
Only three tickets.

If we save them up, we can
get more than a sticker this time.

Stop telling me how
to spend my tickets.

Wow! Can you imagine
what people would say
if they saw us dancing together?

They'd be like,
"What's up with those two?"

I got it. I'll do this and
you play the racing game

Mmm-hmm. Two are in
the Marines, one's a cop.

Angela versus Isabel.
Height, advantage Isabel.

Hey, guys, guys, guys. Excusez-moi.
Hey.

I'm tying a knot in
the stem with my tongue.

Michael, you don't have
to do this.

I would say I kind of
have an unfair advantage,
because I watch reality dating shows like a hawk.

And I learn.
I absorb information

from the strategies of
the winners and the losers.

Actually, I probably
learn more from the losers.

This is exactly
what I don't want.

You are amazing at this.
How did you get so good?

Whacking moles.
Hit him on the head. Whack!

Whack!
Whack! Say it with me.

Hey, monkey, how
you doing? Whack.

Listen, can I talk
to you for a second?

(SIGHS) You know, I've been
thinking, we had a good run,

we really did,
but you don't need to worry

about this whole
contract thing anymore.

It's just that we both...
We want different things.
You know, I want a big family.

No, no, no, no, no.
I want a big family.

Tall, thick. A big,
physically big family.

It's dissolved.
Don't worry. You're free.

Okay? Okay.
We'll see you later.

But we both...
And you didn't do...

Wow! Maybe we should tell
her he's not normally like this.
Maybe it should come from a man.

Maybe it should
come from a note.

You want to pay 400
bucks to re-felt this table?

Yeah! Why don't
you send the bill

to 23 I Don't Care Lane,
Scranton, Pennsylvania?

Hey, Michael, why
don't you just get down?

Hey, she can tell
I'm on a date, right?

Really? You told on me.
That's lame.

We got a problem?
Yes. Homelessness.

I'm just kidding
around. I'm sorry.

Okay, why don't we
just finish the game?
She can't talk to us that way.
You guys are stripes, I think.

You let somebody
talk to you like that,
Well, I am starting it again!
Do you guys want some food?
The wings are really good here.

You embarrassed my friends in
front of me, and I am gonna need you

to go back over to the table
and apologize.

Then I am sorry that
I didn't kick you out.

I'm here with my employees.
I am here on a date.
Well, I'm the manager here, sir.

Well, it just so happens
that I'm a manager, too,

and the way I manage people is
that I touch their hearts and souls

with humor, with love and
maybe a dash of razzle-dazzle,
and I don't see that from you.
Is that how you do it?

Yes, it is.
I'm writing a book about it.

Really? How much
have you written?

If you're really interested,
it is called Somehow I Manage,

and there's going to be a picture
of me on the cover shrugging

Have you read Lee
lacocca's? It's classic.
But no, I have not read it.

You're not gonna want to put it
down. It's gonna make you want

to go out and buy
a Chrysler tomorrow.

We just have to throw everyone off
the scent a little, so follow my lead.

I don't normally do
this, but... Do what?

Go, go. Just sit down
next to a beautiful woman

and start talking to myself
to confuse other people.

Hey, big boy. Do you
like it when I do that?

We didn't say we were gonna,
like, start groping strangers.
I was flirting with a man.

Where did you learn
to talk like that?

ERIN: The movies.
I don't know.

ANDY: What movie?
Black Snake Moan?

I manage a paper company.
Dunder Mifflin-Sabre.

I did. I actually
put it in your bowl.

Whoa! A lot of Stanley
Hudsons in here.
You just won yourself a lunch.

I'm sorry.
He's not usually like that.

(CLEARS THROAT) So, when
are you coming in for that free lunch?

You're gonna want to come
in on a day that I'm working.

Maybe I can hear
more about that book, too.

Hey, man. You put together a
pretty fun night for everybody.

I saw you talking to Hide. Did
you hear that dude's life story?

I couldn't understand
a word he said.

Let me tell you something,
Oscar, all right?

Matt's an okay dude,
but he's a dummy.
You guys got nothing in common.

Maybe you're right. I
should count myself lucky.

Anyone up for some hoops?
Yeah. Hoops!

Let's do it.
OSCAR: Hoop it. Yeah.

This is not what I want
my relationship to look like.

My name is Andrew Bernard and
I've been on two dates with Erin Hannon

and they went well, and
there will probably be more.
You know, it got to the point

where keeping it a secret
was just too much drama.

And I hate drama,
so... There you go.

This move?
He can't get you.

I think that he could
counter that move.

The Scranton Strangler
is a professional strangler.

Oh, please. I wish he'd come
after me. I would be like...

Dwight Kurt Schrute.
Shut up, what?

You are hereby served
with this summons

to appear in
Lackawanna County court...

No, no, no.
...for breach of contract

What are you talking
about? What are you...

Dwight recently entered into a
contract with me, establishing intent

to conceive and raise
a child with me. Angela.

Did he not tell you that?
What?

You're really putting me
in an awkward position here.

Do you plan on
raising a child with me,

or do you plan on
breaking this contract?

You will see me in
small claims court!

And I spilled my drink and
they wouldn't give me a refill.

Oh, my gosh. Okay, yeah,
we have to get home.

Halperts, wait up!
What a great night!
Got to hang out with my peeps.

Sort of did okay
with a new young lady.

Actually you didn't.
Not at all.

I think I did, but I
can't take all the credit.

Some of the credit is due, in
fact, to my good friend Date Mike.
